payload.message:
Reminder: Night Recap for Sean (daily 10pm ET).

Goal:
Provide a sharp recap of the day, especially updates after noon, plus progress on ongoing tasks.

Sections:
1) Day recap (key events/outcomes)
2) Notable developments after 12pm
3) Task/project progress
   - What moved forward
   - What is pending
   - Risks/blockers
4) Carry-forward plan for tomorrow
   - Top priorities
   - Suggested first actions

Execution requirements:
- Use sub-agents when useful to gather updates from different workstreams in parallel.
- Thorough but digestible: prioritize signal.
- Mention concrete files/projects touched when relevant.

Delivery:
- Announce final recap to Sean in this chat.

Reminder: This is a recurring reminder to update Sean's Pikachu ex #276 (Ascended Heroes, English) tracker.

Goal:
- Refresh /Users/sean/.openclaw/workspace/pokemon-trackers/pikachu-ex-276/data.json
- Also refresh /Users/sean/.openclaw/workspace/pokemon-trackers/pikachu-ex-276/data.js as: window.TRACKER_DATA = <same JSON>;
- Improve and expand /Users/sean/.openclaw/workspace/pokemon-trackers/pikachu-ex-276/index.html over time

What to do each run:
1) Re-fetch latest data from:
   - https://www.pricecharting.com/game/pokemon-ascended-heroes/pikachu-ex-276
   - https://www.pricecharting.com/game/pokemon-ascended-heroes/pikachu-ex-277
   - https://www.pricecharting.com/game/pokemon-ascended-heroes/mega-froslass-ex-275
   - PSA 10 reference listing: https://www.ebay.com/itm/117033623984
2) Extract/refresh:
   - Ungraded/graded estimates (incl. PSA10)
   - Recent raw sale rows (date/source/title/price/url)
   - PSA population stats (PSA10 pop and total pop if visible)
   - Raw-vs-graded spread metrics (median raw, PSA10/raw multiple)
   - Comparable card snapshot metrics
3) Update dashboard visuals and add useful stats/charts when possible.
4) Keep page readable and visual-forward (cards, KPI tiles, charts, links, notes).
5) If parsing fails, keep existing data and append a note in data.json notes about the failure and timestamp.

Output:
- Save files in place and summarize what changed in your completion message.

Reminder: Morning Bell report for Sean (daily 8am ET).

Style goals:
- Friendly, motivating, digestible, high-signal.
- Do NOT be fluffy. Distill complexity without dumbing it down.
- Learn from Sean’s preferences over time and improve format each day.

Mission:
Create a high-quality morning briefing that helps Sean start the day well.

Sections (in order):
1) Today at a glance (3-6 bullets)
2) Calendar summary (Apple Calendar preferred; Google Calendar fallback)
   - Events today with times + short context
   - Upcoming reminders/important items for next 48 hours
   - Flag conflicts, tight transitions, commute/travel constraints if inferable
3) Active workstreams / status updates
   - What we were working on recently
   - Progress, blockers, and what changed since last report
4) Suggested actions (3-7 practical suggestions)
   - Include actions Sean can do, plus actions you can do proactively if requested
5) Optional “nice-to-have” (short)
   - One thoughtful suggestion or optimization for the day

Execution requirements:
- Use sub-agents heavily for research/synthesis when useful; parallelize work and merge results.
- Spend enough time for a thorough report.
- If calendar access is missing, clearly report what is needed once, then continue with everything else.
- Keep output scannable with headers + bullets.

Delivery:
- Announce the final report to Sean in this chat.

Reminder: Noon Intelligence Digest for Sean (weekdays 12pm ET).

Goal:
Deliver a concise-but-thorough news + ideas brief that is current, insightful, and relevant.

Topic priorities:
- General breaking news
- Tech, AI, programming
- Finance, crypto, politics
- Pokemon
- Photography, music, guitar
- Video games, movies

Output format:
1) Top 10 highlights (one-line each)
2) Deep dives (5-8 items)
   - Why it matters
   - Key facts and uncertainty level
   - Potential implications/opinions (brief)
3) Opportunities / actions
   - 3-6 actionable ideas for Sean
4) Watchlist
   - Emerging stories to monitor over next 24-72h

Execution requirements:
- Use multiple sub-agents in parallel for different topic clusters and merge.
- Prioritize credible sources and recency.
- Distill complexity without oversimplification.
- Avoid clickbait and low-value noise.

Delivery:
- Announce final digest to Sean in this chat.

Reminder: Weekly format tuning pass for Sean’s scheduled reports.

Goal:
Improve report quality/style based on the last week of Morning Bell, Noon Intelligence Digest, and Night Recap outputs.

Tasks:
1) Review recent report outputs and identify what was strong vs weak:
   - clarity, signal-to-noise, digestibility, actionability, tone fit
2) Produce concrete tuning recommendations:
   - section order, length, density, bullets vs paragraphs, recurring sections to add/remove
3) Apply minor safe tuning updates directly when clearly beneficial.
4) If a major change is uncertain, propose 2-3 options and ask Sean for preference.
5) Track a short changelog of tuning decisions so style evolves intentionally.

Execution requirements:
- Use sub-agents where useful for critique + synthesis.
- Keep recommendations practical and specific.

Delivery:
- Announce weekly tuning summary to Sean in Discord.
